instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with liquid damage on ISL625 area. It wasnt turning on. Changed ISL reconstructed some traces. Now it turns on, from powr adapter and battery but not charging. PPBUS is 8.20V that means that there is a problem with SMC but it is turning on. 


All rails except PPBUS are ok. Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS charger only no battery is 8.2?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Yes with battery and without it's 8.2V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message:
Do you get orange light on Magsafe?
Did you try known good battery?

Post voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Be sure to have good solders and traces on pins 10/11 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Yeah do you get a light on the charger? Is the battery recognized in OSX? My guess would be same as 2informaticos possibly bad soldering on pins 11 of ISL or bad ISL. Also possible bad SMC but that is the last thing to check.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Yes. It was bad soldered pins. Repaired traces again and now PPBUS is 8,47 and computer working fine. Is it important that 0,2V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Yes very very important. 8.2 vs 8.6 on Airs and 12.2 vs 12.6 on Pros is the difference in the SMC not running vs the SMC running

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: No, i mean now it is 8,4-8,5 and must be 8,6. So i gues that smc is running ( it was 8,2 before fixing) Computer is working fine right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: 8.47 could be just a multimeter thing that's fairly close to 8.5. Mine always measures around 8.58 so not exactly 8.6

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
